data.name: TOEIC Reading Partie 7(B) - Textes multiples - Entraînement 217

translations.title: Training Mode
translations.description: Progressez à votre rythme avec des entrainements organisés par exercices.

translations.title: Reading
translations.description:
La section Reading est composée de 4 exercices pour 100 questions en tout.

Elle dure environ 75 minutes. Les consignes sont données au début de chaque partie. Vous devez répondre à un maximum de questions dans le temps qui vous est donné sachant qu’il n’y a pas de point négatif dans ce test. 

ATTENTION : le jour du test vous devrez griser les bonnes réponses sur une feuille de réponse séparée. Il est formellement interdit d’écrire dans les livrets d’examen.

Contenu :

Ex 5 - Phrases à trous : 30 questions

Ex 6 - Textes à trous : 16 questions

Ex 7 (A) - Passages simples : 29 questions

Ex 7 (B) - Passages multiples : 25 questions

Remarque : il n’y pas d’ordre imposé pour réaliser les exercices de la section reading. En fonction de vos facilités et de votre stratégie, vous pouvez commencer par l’exercice que vous le souhaitez. Essayez différentes stratégies avant le jour du test afin de voir dans quelle configuration vous êtes le plus à l’aise.

translations.title: Partie 7(B) - Textes multiples
translations.description:
Sur GlobalExam : La partie 7(B) comporte 25 questions portant sur 2 textes doubles et 3 textes triples. Chaque groupe de texte sera suivi de 5 questions. Pour vous aider, 4 options par question vous seront proposées. Choisissez la bonne réponse.

Le jour J : Les textes simples et doubles s’enchaînent dans la même partie. Chaque texte est suivi de 3 à 5 questions évaluant votre compréhension. Pour y répondre, vous avez le choix entre 4 propositions de réponse. Le tout est indiqué sur le livret d'examen. Reportez la bonne réponse sur la feuille de réponse. Il vous est interdit d’écrire dans le livret.

Conseil : Lisez les questions et mémorisez les mots clés avant de commencer votre lecture. Dès que vous trouvez une réponse, indiquez-la afin de vous libérer l’esprit et de vous sentir avancer.

data.name: In the chat conversation, the word “standouts” is closest in meaning to…

translations.explanation: “Standout” can mean any of the choices given. In this context, it means someone who is better than the others, or whose resume looks better than the others.

exam_answers.name: someone who protests against something
someone who is easily noticeable
someone who is taller than others
someone who is better than others

data.name: Which of these are necessary to be eligible for the position?

translations.explanation:
The ad tells us that a degree is required. A degree is earned through a university.
(A) - Transferable skills are necessary if applicants do not have relevant work experience.
(B) is desirable but not essential, and so, not necessary.
(D) - The applicant has experience working with families, but the ad does not ask for this.

exam_answers.name: Transferable skills
Experience working in healthcare
A university education
Experience working with families

translations.explanation:
Ms. Exter has worked as a psychotherapist in a high school and with families at a maternity clinic. This experience will be useful in her potential job.
(A) - Ms. Exter would work towards a degree if she were given the opportunity.
(C) - Ms. Exter was a high school psychotherapist, not a teacher.
(D) - Ms. Exter does not mention what she has and has not studied.

exam_answers.name: She is working toward a degree.
She has transferable skills.
She was a high school teacher.
She has studied social work as a subject.

translations.explanation:
John thinks that working at a hospital will present bigger challenges than working at a high school and maternity clinic.
(A) - John would prefer Ms. Exter to have more experience, but this does not seem to be his primary concern.
(B) - Mentors are not mentioned.
(D) - Ms. Exter would only be studying if the opportunity came with the job, so this is not a concern for John.

exam_answers.name: She has limited experience.
She'd need mentoring.
She wouldn't be able to cope with the workload.
Her studies would interfere with her work.

data.name: What does the hospital staff think about Ms. Exter’s application?

translations.explanation:
The team agrees that Ms. Exter has applied too soon in her career, that she should apply again in the future.
(A) - They do not think she will make a good addition to the team - yet.
(B) - John is mostly concerned about her lack of experience, the team in general would like to see her apply again in the future.
(C) - None of the applicants have been particularly good, but she was identified as having some potential.

exam_answers.name: She will make a good addition to the team.
She lacks sufficient experience.
She's as good as the other applicants so far.
She should try again at a later date.

translations.name: TOEIC - Parcours Objectif ∙ +180 ∙ From 785 To 990 Points
Dompte le listening et le Reading
